  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour">CustomBehaviour</a></>}>
Class which can be overriden by targets to enforce instruction dependencies and behaviours that aren&#39;t expressed well enough within the scheduling model for mca to automatically simulate them properly. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

This class allows targets to optionally customize the logic that resolves scheduling class IDs. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instrumentmanager/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

This file defines the base class CustomBehaviour which can be inherited from by specific targets (ex.

llvm/tools/llvm-mca/lib/X86CustomBehaviour.h). CustomBehaviour is designed to enforce custom behaviour and dependencies within the llvm-mca pipeline simulation that llvm-mca isn&#39;t already capable of extracting from the Scheduling Models.

<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a62666ccd5a13e55da4d4b03c80a4c75f"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a62666ccd5a13e55da4d4b03c80a4c75f">~CustomBehaviour</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Before the llvm-mca pipeline dispatches an instruction, it first checks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for any register or resource dependencies / hazards. If it doesn&#39;t find</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// any, this method will be invoked to determine if there are any custom</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// hazards that the instruction needs to wait for.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The return value of this method is the number of cycles that the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instruction needs to wait for.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It&#39;s safe to underestimate the number of cycles to wait for since these</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// checks will be invoked again before the intruction gets dispatched.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// However, it&#39;s not safe (accurate) to overestimate the number of cycles</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to wait for since the instruction will wait for AT LEAST that number of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// cycles before attempting to be dispatched again.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a1733693fc63741279331007c38453223">checkCustomHazard</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;InstRef&gt;</a> IssuedInst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">                                     </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Functions that target CBs can override to return a list of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// target specific Views that need to live within /lib/Target/ so that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// they can benefit from the target CB or from backend functionality that is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not already exposed through MC-layer classes. Keep in mind that how this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function is used is that the function is called within llvm-mca.cpp and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then each unique&#95;ptr&lt;View&gt; is passed into the PipelinePrinter::addView()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function. This function will then std::move the View into its own vector of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Views. So any CB that overrides this function needs to make sure that they</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are not relying on the current address or reference of the View</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unique&#95;ptrs. If you do need the CB and View to be able to communicate with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// each other, consider giving the View a reference or pointer to the CB when</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the View is constructed. Then the View can query the CB for information</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when it needs it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return a vector of Views that will be added before all other Views.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;View&gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#ad9342f37242dde1bc862f0441a82fd5e">getStartViews</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinstprinter">llvm::MCInstPrinter</a> &amp;IP, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">llvm::ArrayRef&lt;llvm::MCInst&gt;</a> Insts);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return a vector of Views that will be added after the InstructionInfoView.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;View&gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a6d04044329947a112b3194db8b15a49e">getPostInstrInfoViews</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinstprinter">llvm::MCInstPrinter</a> &amp;IP,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">                        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">llvm::ArrayRef&lt;llvm::MCInst&gt;</a> Insts);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return a vector of Views that will be added after all other Views.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;View&gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a0a73f42bda40682efac9f25123e4e8bd">getEndViews</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinstprinter">llvm::MCInstPrinter</a> &amp;IP, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">llvm::ArrayRef&lt;llvm::MCInst&gt;</a> Insts);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// return a SchedClassID. This can be used by a subtarget to return a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PseudoInstruction SchedClassID instead of the one that belongs to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BaseInstruction This can be useful when a BaseInstruction does not convey</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the correct scheduling information without additional data. By default,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it returns the SchedClassID that belongs to MCI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
